etymologies: late Middle English (denoting a pampered child): origin uncertain; it is apparently not the same word as Middle English cokeney ‘cock's egg’, denoting a small misshapen egg (probably from cock + obsolete ey ‘egg’). A later sense was ‘a town-dweller regarded as affected or puny’, from which the current sense arose in the early 17th century

definitions: a native of East London, traditionally one born within hearing of Bow Bells.
shortDefinitions: native of East London, traditionally one born within hearing of Bow Bells

definitions: the dialect or accent typical of cockneys.
shortDefinitions: dialect or accent typical of such people

definitions: of or characteristic of cockneys or their dialect or accent
shortDefinitions: of or characteristic of cockneys or their dialect or accent
